rules.name: Asking For Help
rules.description: Actually ask your question, don't just ask for "help".

rules.name: Explain What's Wrong
rules.description: Don't ask why your code doesn't "work".

rules.name: Be Patient
rules.description: Responses to your questions are not guaranteed. The people here offer their expertise on their own time and for free.

rules.name: @Mentioning People
rules.description: Do not ping a user or group regarding coding help unless you are responding to them in an existing conversation.

rules.name: Keep it clean.
rules.description: Keep it clean; some people use this at work/school.

rules.name: Privacy
rules.description: Don't share private information with anyone! (you’re just asking to be hacked)

rules.name: No Advertising
rules.description: Don't advertise, it's as simple as that.

rules.name: Use The Right Channel
rules.description: Stick to the appropriate channels. Feel free to ask in [#general](https://discord.gg/qZfADKn) if you're not sure where to ask something.

rules.name: Use Codeblocks
rules.description: When posting code, please use code blocks (see `?codeblock` for help).

rules.name: Bot Additions
rules.description: Don't ask for your bot to be added. It won’t be.

rules.name: Verified Role
rules.description: Don't ask to become Verified: doing so will make it less likely.

rules.name: Don't Ask Someone To Help In DMs
rules.description: Don't DM people (unless it's for #hiring-or-looking), the knowledge shared here is for the benefit of everyone.

rules.name: Illegal/Immoral Tasks
rules.description: Don't ask for help with illegal or immoral tasks. Doing so not only risks your continued participation in this community but is in violation of Discord's TOS and can get your account banned.

rules.name: No Spoon-feeding
rules.description: No spoon-feeding, it's not useful and won't help anyone learn.
